abstractText: Phthalide, benzoxazole, and chromene are important heterocyclic skeletons with extensive biological activities. In order to develop novel potential antifungal agents, twenty-two benzoxazole/chromene-containing phthalide derivatives were prepared, and their fungicidal activity against nine common plants pathogenic fungi were evaluated in vitro. The EC50 values indicated that compound Z-4b displayed superior antifungal activity against P. oryzae (11.0 μg/mL), F. solani (8.5 μg/mL), P. capsici (27.8 μg/mL), V. mali (3.1 μg/mL) and A. brassicae (4.3 μg/mL) strains, which was more potent than the two commercialized fungicides hymexazol and chlorothalonil. In addition, the structure-activity relationship analysis demonstrated that the combination site of oxazolamide with phthalide has an important effect on antifungal activity. This research offers a potential compound for the development of novel agricultural fungicides.

sections.text:
Phthalide, benzoxazole, and chromene are important heterocyclic skeletons with extensive biological activities. In order to develop novel potential antifungal agents, twenty-two benzoxazole/chromene-containing phthalide derivatives were prepared, and their fungicidal activity against nine common plants pathogenic fungi were evaluated in vitro. The EC50 values indicated that compound Z-4b displayed superior antifungal activity against P. oryzae (11.0 μg/mL), F. solani (8.5 μg/mL), P. capsici (27.8 μg/mL), V. mali (3.1 μg/mL) and A. brassicae (4.3 μg/mL) strains, which was more potent than the two commercialized fungicides hymexazol and chlorothalonil. In addition, the structure-activity relationship analysis demonstrated that the combination site of oxazolamide with phthalide has an important effect on antifungal activity. This research offers a potential compound for the development of novel agricultural fungicides.
KEY WORDS: Phthalide derivatives; benzoxazol; chromene; antifungal activity; phytopathogenic fungi

sections.heading: 1.1. General information
sections.text:
All reagents were purchased from commercial sources. Melting points were detected on a
WRS-1B digital melting-point apparatus (Suzhou Xuan Voli Intelligent Technology Co., Ltd). NMR spectra were obtained on Bruker Avance NEO 400, or 600 MHz instruments, using TMS as the internal standard, CDCl3, DMSO-d6, or CD3CN as the solvent. HRMS were recorded using APEX II Bruker 4.7T AS instrument.

sections.heading: 1.2. General procedure for the synthesis of target compounds
sections.text:
3-butyl-6-(2-methylbut-3-yn-2-yloxy)isobenzofuran-1(3H)-one (2a): To a solution of compound 1 (0.6 g, 2.9 mmol), K2CO3 (1.1 g, 8.2 mmol) and NaI (108.3 mg, 0.72 mmol) in acetone/H2O (10 mL/2 mL), and 3-chloro-3-methylbutyne (0.8 g, 8.2 mmol) was added. The reaction mixture was stirred at 60 o C for 12 h. After completing, the solvent was removed under reduced pressure and the residue was purified by column chromatography to give the compound 2a (504.8 mg, 64.0%) as a colorless oil. 3-butyl-6-(2-methylbut-3-en-2-yloxy)isobenzofuran-1(3H)-one (2b): Compound 2a (300 mg, 1.1 mmol) and Lindlar catalyst (30%, 116.2 mg) were dissolved in hexane (15 mL), and the reaction mixture was stirred at 30 o C for 1 h under hydrogen atmosphere. After completing, the reaction mixture was filtered and the solvent was evaporated in vacuo. The residue was purified by column chromatography to give the compound 2b (298.4 mg, 99.0%) as a colorless oil. 3-butyl-6-hydroxy-7-(3-methylbut-2-en-1-yl)isobenzofuran-1(3H)-one (2c): Compound 2b (274 mg, 1.0 mmol) was dissolved in N-methyl-2-pyrrolidone (NMP, 5 mL), the mixture was stirred at 90 o C for 24 h under argon atmosphere until the reaction was completed. Next, H2O (15 mL) was added and the mixture was extracted with EtOAc (3 × 20 mL). The combined organic was dried over Na2SO4, concentrated in vacuo, and purified by column chromatography to give the compound 2c (139.7 mg, 51.0%) as a white solid. 3-butyl-7,7-dimethyl-3,7-dihydro-1H-furo[3,4-f]chromen-1-one (2d): To a solution of compound 2a (82.2 mg, 0.3 mmol) in dry pyridine (2 mL), after stirring at 120 °C for 8 h, the reaction mixture was adjusted pH = 4 with 2N HCl, which was extracted with EtOAc (20 mL ×2), dried over anhydrous Na2SO4, evaporated and purified with column chromatography to obtain compound 3d (62.7 mg, 76.8%) as a colorless oil.
3-butyl-6-hydroxy-5-nitroisobenzofuran-1(3H)-one (Z-1): To a solution of compound 1 (3.87 g, 12.66 mmol) in acetic acid (5 mL) and DCM (10 mL), 48% nitric acid (5 mL) was added dropwise slowly at 0 °C under a nitrogen atmosphere, the reaction mixture was stirred at 25 °C for 1 h. Next, H2O (15 mL) was added to the mixture and extracted with DCM (30 mL × 3), the combined organic layers were washed with brine, dried over anhydrous Na2SO4, and evaporated in vacuo. The crude residue was purified by column chromatography to give the compound Z-1 (2.15 g, 67.6%) as a white solid. 5-amino-3-butyl-6-hydroxyisobenzofuran-1(3H)-one (Z-2): To a solution of Z-1 (400 mg, 1.59 mmol) in EtOH (5 mL), SnCl2 (1.8 g, 7.96 mmol) was added. The mixture was stirred at 80 o C for 12h under a nitrogen atmosphere (monitored by TLC). Subsequently, the solution was removed under vacuum and adjusted to pH = 7-8 with saturated NaHCO3, which was then extracted with DCM (30 mL × 3), dried over anhydrous Na2SO4, and concentrated in vacuo. The crude product was purified by column chromatography to give the compound Z-2 (267.4 mg, 76.1%) as a white solid. 2-amino-5-butylisobenzofuro[5,6-d]oxazol-7(5H)-one (Z-3): To a solution of compound Z-2 (216.6 mg, 0.98 mmol) in CH3OH (4 mL) and H2O (2 mL), cyanide bromide (BrCN, 154.7 mg, 1.46 mmol) was added dropwise. The reaction mixture was stirred at 65 o C for 5 h under the nitrogen atmosphere, and then adjusted to pH = 7-8 with saturated NaHCO3, the mixture was extracted with EtOAc (30 mL × 3), dried over anhydrous Na2SO4, and evaporated in vacuo. The crude residue was purified by silica gel column chromatography to give the compound Z-3 (177.4 mg, 73.6%) as a white solid. 3-butyl-6-hydroxy-7-nitroisobenzofuran-1(3H)-one (E-1): To a solution of compound 1 (3.3 g, 15.9 mmol) and potassium nitrate (2.1 g, 20.6 mmol) in H2SO4 (15 mL) at 0 o C. The reaction mixture was stirred at 25 o C for 3h and then ice water was added, the mixture was extracted with EtOAc (50 mL × 3), dried over anhydrous Na2SO4, evaporated under reduced pressure, and purified by column chromatography to give the compound E-1 (3.3 g, 83.4%) as a yellow solid. 7-amino-3-butyl-6-hydroxyisobenzofuran-1(3H)-one (E-2): To a solution of E-1 (2.4 g, 9.56 mmol) and iron powder (2.3 g, 41.3 mmol) in CH3OH (5 mL) and H2O (5 mL). The reaction was refluxed for 8h under an argon atmosphere. Then the reaction mixture was filtered and the residue was washed with ethanol, combined filtrate was concentrated under vacuum and purified by column
chromatography to obtain the compound E-2 (1.57 g, 74.3%) as a white solid. 2-amino-6-butylisobenzofuro[4,5-d]oxazol-8(6H)-one (E-3): To a solution of E-2 (1.1 g, 4.97 mmol) and dicyandiamide (1.25 g, 1.49 mmol) in anhydrous THF (5 mL), FeCl3 (2.42 g, 1.49 mmol) in anhydrous THF (5 mL) was added at 0 o C. Then the reaction was heated at 60°C under N2 until completion (TLC monitoring, 48 h). The reaction solvent was evaporated under reduced pressure and the residue was purified by column chromatography to afford the desired product E-3 (448.7 mg, 36.7%) as a white solid. General synthesis procedure for compounds Z-4a-c and E-4a-e
To a solution of Z-3 or E-3 (30.0 mg, 0.12 mmol) in dried pyridine (0.5 mL), substituted acyl
chloride (0.24 mmol) was added slowly at 0 o C. The reaction mixture was stirred at room temperature until the starting material disappearance (monitored by TLC). The reaction mixture was adjusted to pH = 3-4 with 2N HCl and extracted with DCM (10 mL × 3). The organic phase was dried over anhydrous Na2SO4, filtered, evaporated, and purified by column chromatography to give the compounds Z-4a-c and E-4a-e. General synthesis procedure for compounds 5a-f
A suspension of E-2 (114 mg, 0.52 mmol), substituted benzaldehyde (0.57 mmol) and cupric
acetate monohydrate (10 mg, 0.052 mmol) in toluene (4 mL), the reaction mixture was stirred at 90 o C under a nitrogen atmosphere until completion (TLC monitoring). Then the reaction mixture was concentrated, and purified by column chromatography to afford the compounds 5a-f.

sections.heading: 1.3. Antifungal assay
sections.text:
The antifungal activities were determined by the mycelium growth rate method, and the
SPSS 21.0 (SPSS Inc., Chicago, USA) software was used for data analysis. [Li Y, Luo ZF, Luo BL, Lan Q, Fan JD, Xue W, Miao J, Li Y, Tang L, Fan LL. 2020. Design, synthesis and antifungal activities of 6-substituted n-butyphthalide derivatives against phytopathogenic fungi. Chem Biodiversity. 17(10): e2000435.]

sections.heading: 1.4. Molecular docking studies
sections.text:
The crystal structure of the lipid transfer protein sec14p (Saccharomyces cerevisiae) was
obtained from the Brookhaven protein data bank (PDB 6F0E; http://www.rcsb.org/pdb). The molecular docking studies were performed with SYBYL-X 2.0 software according to the previously reported method. [Fan LL, Luo ZF, Yang CF, Tang L, Li Y. 2022. Design and
synthesis of small molecular 2-aminobenzoxazoles as potential antifungal agents against phytopathogenic fungi. Mol Divers. 26: 981-992]

title: Design and synthesis of novel benzoxazole/chromene-phthalide scaffolds hybrids as potential natural products-based fungicide
